explanation: The function mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysctl_fallback_ calls sysctlbyname and sysctl conditionally based on macro definitions. To analyze reachability of the code paths inside these conditional blocks and determine if any part of the code is unreachable (violating the MISRA C rule), the definitions and availability of sysctlbyname and sysctl are needed. Additionally, the macros CTL_HW and HW_NCPU are used to form the mib array passed to sysctl; their presence affects conditional compilation and thus code reachability. Understanding these symbols and their definitions helps decide which code blocks are effectively compiled and reached, enabling accurate analysis of unreachable code within the function.
